agency_desc: A national organization committed to achieving full recognition of the civil rights for the LGBTQ+ community and everyone living with HIV through impact litigation, education and public policy work.
service_description: Provides information and resources relating to discrimination based on sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, and HIV status.
site_details: Visit www.lambdalegal.org/helpdesk to fill out form for legal assistance. -- If calling, leave your name, phone number, email, and reason needing assistance.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing low-cost reproductive health services.
service_description: Offers confidential, in-clinic abortion services to those living in Illinois and surrounding states. Medication abortion, or the abortion pill, is available up to 11 weeks and 0 days gestation; in-clinic, or surgical, abortion services are offered up to 21 weeks and 6 days gestation. Financial assistance may be available.
site_details: Call or visit the website to find clinic locations, make an appointment, or connect with a patient navigator.
site_eligibility: Open; serves pregnant individuals of any age

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing low-cost reproductive health services.
service_description: Offers confidential, in-clinic abortion services to those living in Illinois and surrounding states. Medication abortion, or the abortion pill, is available up to 11 weeks and 0 days gestation; in-clinic, or surgical, abortion services are offered up to 21 weeks and 6 days gestation. Financial assistance may be available.
site_details: Call or visit the website to find clinic locations, make an appointment, or connect with a patient navigator.
site_eligibility: Open; serves pregnant individuals of any age

agency_desc: Offers a faith-based full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: FRANCISCAN SENIOR HEALTH AND WELLNESS - DYER
service_name: PROGRAM OF ALL-INCLUSIVE CARE FOR THE ELDERLY-PACE
service_description: Offer healthcare services and socialization opportunities for individuals who are eligible for nursing home care, but would prefer to live at home.
site_details: Call to begin the pre-enrollment assessment process. -- Ask for intake team.
site_eligibility: Open -- 55 years old and older -- Chronic health conditions that qualify for nursing home care --  Able to live safely in the community

agency_desc: A government agency that promotes the welfare of the wage earners, job seekers, and retirees of the United States.
site_name: EMPLOYEE BENEFITS SECURITY ADMINISTRATION - CHICAGO REGIONAL
service_name: EMPLOYEE BENEFITS SECURITY ADMINISTRATION - CHICAGO REGIONAL OFFICE
service_description: Regulates retirement, insurance (including COBRA), pension, and other workplace-related benefits programs. This agency investigates complaints about employee benefit plans, and provides assistance in obtaining benefits or in understanding retirement and health benefit laws.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_schedule: Regional Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- National Helpline: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm
site_eligibility: Living in northern Indiana -- With employee-benefit questions or concerns

site_schedule: Regional Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- National Helpline: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm

agency_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES
agency_desc: A federal government agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States.
site_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES - CHICAGO DACA LOCKBOX
service_description: Answers questions and provides information regarding Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), an administration policy that provides eligible, undocumented immigrants a two-year deferred deportation and possible employment authorization.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Automated line and website: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: To request consideration: Under the age of 31 as of June 15, 2012 -- Arrived in the US before 16th birthday -- Have continuously resided in the US since June 15, 2007, to the present time -- Physically present in the US on June 15, 2012, and at the time of requesting deferred action with USCIS -- Entered without inspection before June 15, 2012, or lawful immigration status expired as of June 15, 2012 -- Currently in school, graduated or obtained a certificate of completion from high school, obtained a GED, or are an honorably discharged veteran of the Coast Guard or Armed Forces of the United States -- Have not been convicted of a felony, significant misdemeanor, three or more other misdemeanors, and do not otherwise pose a threat to national security or public safety

agency_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES
agency_desc: A federal government agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States.
site_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES - CHICAGO DACA LOCKBOX
service_description: Answers questions and provides information regarding Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), an administration policy that provides eligible, undocumented immigrants a two-year deferred deportation and possible employment authorization.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Automated line and website: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: To request consideration: Under the age of 31 as of June 15, 2012 -- Arrived in the US before 16th birthday -- Have continuously resided in the US since June 15, 2007, to the present time -- Physically present in the US on June 15, 2012, and at the time of requesting deferred action with USCIS -- Entered without inspection before June 15, 2012, or lawful immigration status expired as of June 15, 2012 -- Currently in school, graduated or obtained a certificate of completion from high school, obtained a GED, or are an honorably discharged veteran of the Coast Guard or Armed Forces of the United States -- Have not been convicted of a felony, significant misdemeanor, three or more other misdemeanors, and do not otherwise pose a threat to national security or public safety

agency_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES
agency_desc: A federal government agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States.
site_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES - CHICAGO FIELD
service_description: Handles scheduled interviews on non-asylum-related immigration applications. Most applications can be filed online or by mail. Appointments can be scheduled for the local office for applications or petitions that require in-person filing.
site_details: Call the National Customer Service Center or use the online INFOPASS (infopass.uscis.gov) to schedule an appointment. (Appointments are required for in-person visits or to speak with a local Immigration Information Officer.)
site_schedule: Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Chicago Field Office: Mon-Fri, by appointment only
site_eligibility: Filing a USCIS form that requires a visit to the local field office

agency_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES
agency_desc: A federal government agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States.
site_name: UNITED STATES CITIZENSHIP AND IMMIGRATION SERVICES - CHICAGO FIELD
service_description: Handles scheduled interviews on non-asylum-related immigration applications. Most applications can be filed online or by mail. Appointments can be scheduled for the local office for applications or petitions that require in-person filing.
site_details: Call the National Customer Service Center or use the online INFOPASS (infopass.uscis.gov) to schedule an appointment. (Appointments are required for in-person visits or to speak with a local Immigration Information Officer.)
site_schedule: Phone: Mon-Fri 8am-8pm -- Chicago Field Office: Mon-Fri, by appointment only
site_eligibility: Filing a USCIS form that requires a visit to the local field office

agency_desc: Federal agency in charge of mail delivery and related services.
service_description: Accepts complaints of suspected mail scams, including sweepstakes mailings, work-at-home offers, and lotteries. Also accepts reports of mail theft, tampering, and identity theft when the United States Mail is used. A website with tips and educational information is available to help people avoid becoming a victims.
site_details: Call or visit the website to file a report; anonymous reports are accepted.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Federal agency in charge of mail delivery and related services.
service_description: Accepts complaints of suspected mail scams, including sweepstakes mailings, work-at-home offers, and lotteries. Also accepts reports of mail theft, tampering, and identity theft when the United States Mail is used. A website with tips and educational information is available to help people avoid becoming a victims.
site_details: Call or visit the website to file a report; anonymous reports are accepted.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides free credit reports, information about credit monitoring, and identity theft protection
service_description: Enables consumers to place a fraud alert in their files, alerting potential lenders to the fact that they may have been victims of identity theft. Doing so makes it more difficult for credit to be granted on an account, helping protect against further fraudulent use.
site_details: Call or visit the website to place a fraud alert.
site_eligibility: Anyone suspecting identity theft

agency_desc: Provides free credit reports, information about credit monitoring, and identity theft protection
service_description: Maintains credit information on consumers throughout the country. Offers individual credit reports and scores and provides an avenue for individuals to dispute information on their credit reports. Everyone is entitled to receive one free credit report from each of the three credit reporting agencies per year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides free credit reports, information about credit monitoring, and identity theft protection
service_description: Blocks an identity thief from opening a new account or obtaining credit in the victim's name by denying lenders access to the victim's credit report. There is no fee for Indiana residents to place, temporarily lift, or remove a credit freeze from any of the three consumer credit reporting agencies.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.
site_name: CHICAGO VET CENTER- VETERANS HEALTH ADMINISTRATION
service_description: Offers a peer support program using reintegration counseling to help combat veterans and their families cope with stress, transition into civilian life, and reduce barriers to care. Services include individual, marriage, and family counseling, bereavement and military sexual trauma (MST) counseling, and referrals.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or walk in during regular business hours; call to make an after hours or weekend appointment
site_eligibility: United States combat war veterans and their immediate families

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS

agency_desc: A federal government organization that provides federal support and assistance in the areas of disaster preparation, prevention, and recovery. Upon declaring a disaster, this agency offers grants or low-interest loans to eligible individuals and businesses for disaster-related expenses, such as temporary housing, building repairs, and replacement of property.
service_description: Provides financial assistance to the victims of the March 2023 tornadoes. Federal money can be used for temporary housing and home repairs, low-cost loans to cover uninsured property losses, and other programs to help individuals and business owners recover from the disaster.
site_details: Visit www.disasterassistance.gov or call 800-621-3362 to apply for assistance. -- After you apply you will be given a 9-digit FEMA registration number. Make sure to keep that number because it will be needed whenever you contact FEMA.
site_schedule: Customer Service: Mon-Fri 7am-1am -- Online Application: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Living in Johnson, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, or Sullivan County -- Victim of the March 2023 tornadoes

agency_desc: A federal government organization that provides federal support and assistance in the areas of disaster preparation, prevention, and recovery. Upon declaring a disaster, this agency offers grants or low-interest loans to eligible individuals and businesses for disaster-related expenses, such as temporary housing, building repairs, and replacement of property.
service_description: Provides federal support and assistance in the areas of disaster preparation, prevention, and recovery. Upon declaring a disaster, this agency offers grants or low-interest loans to eligible individuals and businesses for disaster-related expenses, such as temporary housing, building repairs, and replacement of property.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by program; this regional office serves six states including Indiana

agency_desc: Volunteers who organize peer support groups for persons with depression, anxiety, and bipolar disorder and their family and friends.
service_description: Maintains a listing of local support groups and online real time support group meetings.  Offers educational brochures for all ages about depression and bipolar disorder.
site_details: Visit the website for local support groups or register for online support groups.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Volunteers who organize peer support groups for persons with depression, anxiety, and bipolar disorder and their family and friends.
service_description: Maintains a listing of local support groups and online real time support group meetings.  Offers educational brochures for all ages about depression and bipolar disorder.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit the website for local support groups or register for online support groups.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The federal agency responsible for registering citizens for selective service.
service_description: Provides registration for the United States Selective Service, which is required for most males, ages 18 through 25, who are US citizens or immigrants living in the United States.
site_details: Register using any of the following methods: Online at www.sss.gov (Social Security number required for this method) -- By Mail: Forms are available at all US post offices, and Reminder Mailback Cards are also sent directly to many men around age 18. (Postage required.) -- At School: Many high schools have an appointed Selective Service Registrar. -- On Federal Student Financial Aid (FAFSA) forms: Mark the Selective Service checkbox. For information about your selective service number, proof of registration, and other issues, call the Registration Information Office.
site_eligibility: Selective Service registration is required for ALL persons meeting the following criteria: Males  -- Age 18-25 years-old (early submission possible starting at age 17 years-old and 3 months) -- US citizens, dual nationals, or immigrants living in the United States (except those with student or visitor visas or who are part of a diplomatic or trade mission) -- Not currently serving in the military on full-time active duty or staying in a hospital, mental institution, or prison

agency_name: UNITED STATES IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT - DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY
agency_desc: A federal agency that promotes homeland security and public safety through the criminal and civil enforcement of federal laws governing border control, customs, trade, and immigration.
site_name: IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT - CHICAGO FIELD
service_description: Provides information about persons who are currently detained by United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement or who have been released from custody within the past 60 days. The person's country of birth and exact first and last name or A-Number are required.
site_details: Call for information or visit website. The following information is needed: 9-digit A-Number and country of birth -OR- First name, last name, and country of birth (exact spelling required)
site_eligibility: Searchable website includes only persons who: Are currently in ICE custody or were released within past 60 days -- Are ages 18 or older

agency_name: UNITED STATES IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT - DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY
agency_desc: A federal agency that promotes homeland security and public safety through the criminal and civil enforcement of federal laws governing border control, customs, trade, and immigration.
site_name: IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT - CHICAGO FIELD
service_description: Provides information about persons who are currently detained by United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement or who have been released from custody within the past 60 days. The person's country of birth and exact first and last name or A-Number are required.
site_details: Call for information or visit website. The following information is needed: 9-digit A-Number and country of birth -OR- First name, last name, and country of birth (exact spelling required)
site_eligibility: Searchable website includes only persons who: Are currently in ICE custody or were released within past 60 days -- Are ages 18 or older

agency_desc: A national and online group of concerned relatives and friends whose lives have been adversely affected by a loved one's addiction to alcohol or drugs.
service_description: Offers 12-Step support groups (both online and at select locations nationwide) for persons whose lives have been adversely affected by a loved one's addiction to alcohol or drugs. Evansville and Floyds Knobs are the ONLY physical meetings in Indiana.
taxonomy_name: Families/Friends of Individuals With an Alcohol Use Disorder Support Groups
nameLevel5: Families/Friends of Individuals With an Alcohol Use Disorder Support Groups
site_details: Visit the website to find meeting information.
site_eligibility: Family and friends of a person with addictions

agency_desc: A national and online group of concerned relatives and friends whose lives have been adversely affected by a loved one's addiction to alcohol or drugs.
service_description: Offers 12-Step support groups (both online and at select locations nationwide) for persons whose lives have been adversely affected by a loved one's addiction to alcohol or drugs. Evansville and Floyds Knobs are the ONLY physical meetings in Indiana.
taxonomy_name: Families/Friends of Individuals With a Drug Use Disorder Support Groups
nameLevel5: Families/Friends of Individuals With a Drug Use Disorder Support Groups
site_details: Visit the website to find meeting information.
site_eligibility: Family and friends of a person with addictions

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to finding a cure for Sarcoidosis and to improving care for Sarcoidosis patients.
service_description: Offers information online and over the phone for Sarcoidosis patients and their families, friends, and caregivers. The website lists support groups, provides a virtual resource library, research studies, and includes a locator tool for finding specialized physicians.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to finding a cure for Sarcoidosis and to improving care for Sarcoidosis patients.
service_description: Offers web locator to find peer-to-peer support groups for persons with Sarcoidosis and their families. Peers meet to discuss and share feelings on various effects of Sarcoidosis disease. Contacts are provided for the facilitators of the groups. Meetings time and location will vary.
site_details: Visit the website; search for a support group by typing a city, state, or country name. -- Email a facilitator through website to confirm the meeting schedule to attend.
site_schedule: National Helpline: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm -- Meeting Times: Vary
site_eligibility: Persons diagnosed with Sarcoidosis, their families, and caregivers

agency_desc: A national, nonprofit health agency dedicated to finding treatments and cures for muscular dystrophy, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), and other neuromuscular diseases.
service_description: Provides information about neuromuscular diseases, including muscular dystrophy and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). Provides access to local MDA clinics in the region that provide testing, biopsy, follow-up, and genetic counseling for neuromuscular disorders. Offers referrals to local resources, such as where to obtain medical equipment, support groups and social services, for persons with neuromuscular disease.
site_details: Call the national office or visit the website for information or referrals to local MDA clinics.
site_eligibility: Persons with disabilities and their families

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers income-eligible immigrants a wide range of legal services from attorneys and trained staff.
service_description: Provides consultation, direct legal services, and representation for immigration services, family based petitions, unaccompanied immigrant children, naturalization, citizenship, LGBT immigrants, and refugee adjustment. Services include applications for cases involving Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), asylum, Green Cards, or work permits, U visa for victims of crimes, and T visa for victims of trafficking. Assists people in deportation proceedings or renewals, consular proceedings and waivers, Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) petitions, and with special immigrant juvenile status, and the Nicaraguan Adjustment/Central American Relief Act (NACARA).
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A national nonprofit agency with a mission to keep American runaway, homeless, and at-risk youth safe and off the streets.
service_description: Provides 24-hour, confidential crisis intervention by phone and Internet chat. Offers support, information, and referrals to runaway, homeless, or at-risk youth as well as their friends, family, and other concerned persons. Can arrange message delivery between youth and parents or guardians, and conference service between youth and parents and/or appropriate agencies. Works with Greyhound to provide transportation home to runaways or youth in crisis after verification.
site_details: Call or visit the website (www.1800runaway.org) to talk to a live specialist, or send an email for assistance.
site_schedule: Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Live Chat: Daily 4:30pm-11:30pm
site_eligibility: Ages 12-21 -- Runaway, homeless, or at-risk youth -OR-Friends, family, or other persons concerned about an at-risk youth

agency_desc: A national nonprofit agency with a mission to keep American runaway, homeless, and at-risk youth safe and off the streets.
service_description: Provides 24-hour, confidential crisis intervention by phone and Internet chat. Offers support, information, and referrals to runaway, homeless, or at-risk youth as well as their friends, family, and other concerned persons. Can arrange message delivery between youth and parents or guardians, and conference service between youth and parents and/or appropriate agencies. Works with Greyhound to provide transportation home to runaways or youth in crisis after verification.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website (www.1800runaway.org) to talk to a live specialist, or send an email for assistance.
site_schedule: Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Live Chat: Daily 4:30pm-11:30pm
site_eligibility: Ages 12-21 -- Runaway, homeless, or at-risk youth -OR-Friends, family, or other persons concerned about an at-risk youth

agency_desc: A volunteer program run by the United States government.
service_description: Places volunteers worldwide to live, learn, and work with a community for 27 months, providing technical assistance in the areas of education, community development, health, business, agriculture, and environment. A monthly stipend is provided for living expenses while overseas; transitional funds are provided upon return.
site_details: Call or visit website for information about application procedures and service opportunities.
site_eligibility: US citizens -- Age 18 or older -- With a college degree in any field or 5 years work or volunteer experience

agency_desc: A government agency that administers comprehensive retirement, survivor, unemployment and sickness benefit programs for the nation's railroad workers and their families .
service_description: Administers pensions, unemployment, and sickness benefits for employees in, or closely affiliated with, the railroad industry. Upon retirement, disability, or death of the earner, benefits are paid from trust funds supported by contributions from railroad employers and employees. Beneficiaries are eligible for Medicare.
site_details: Call for information; most services can be initiated via phone to save a trip to the office. -- To look up nearest field office, visit www.rrb.gov.
site_eligibility: Railroad industry employees and their families

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers support to children experiencing a loss.
service_description: Offers a weekly support group for children grieving a loss from a life-altering crisis such as death, divorce, or other trauma.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to register.
site_eligibility: Age 3-18 years-old -- Experienced a life-altering crisis

agency_desc: The Fussy Baby Network provides supportive services and referrals to families with infants in need.
service_description: Operates a helpline for parents with children up to 15 months of age who are concerned about crying, sleeping, feeding patterns and infant development, and assists parents who are overwhelmed/exhausted with support services.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Parents with children aged 15 months and under

agency_name: EDWARD HINES JR VETERANS AFFAIRS HOSPITAL
agency_desc: A veterans' hospital providing primary care and specialty care services, as well as community-based outpatient clinics.
site_name: EDWARD HINES JR VETERANS AFFAIRS HOSPITAL
service_description: Provides veteran's with primary care and specialty care services, including mental health, women's health, post-traumatic stress disorder, inpatient rehabilitation, oral surgery, dental care, and orthopedics.
site_details: New patients call or walk in the hospital to begin the eligibility paperwork. -- Returning patients (and new patients who have received a letter of approval), call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservists/National Guard) and their dependents --  (If deceased) surviving spouse, child, or parent

agency_name: EDWARD HINES JR VETERANS AFFAIRS HOSPITAL
agency_desc: A veterans' hospital providing primary care and specialty care services, as well as community-based outpatient clinics.
service_description: Provides outpatient primary medical and specialty care, including mental health, pharmacy, and laboratory services for veterans.
site_details: Call for intake information and to schedule an appointment. -- Eligibility must be determined before service is provided.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservist/National Guard) and their dependents (or the surviving spouses, children, or parents of deceased veterans)

agency_name: EDWARD HINES JR VETERANS AFFAIRS HOSPITAL
agency_desc: A veterans' hospital providing primary care and specialty care services, as well as community-based outpatient clinics.
service_description: Provides outpatient primary medical and specialty care, including mental health, pharmacy, and laboratory services for veterans.
site_details: Call for intake information and to schedule an appointment. -- Eligibility must be determined before service is provided.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservist/National Guard) and their dependents (or the surviving spouses, children, or parents of deceased veterans)

agency_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER
agency_desc: A government healthcare agency that provides complete medical, surgical, and neurological care for eligible veterans. Also provides nursing home care for eligible veterans.
site_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER
service_description: Provides comprehensive inpatient and outpatient health care services to qualified veterans, including doctor's visits, laboratory work, surgery, rehabilitation, and pharmacy services. Co-pay determined by benefits and income.
site_details: New Patients: Visit the website, call, or walk in to the Registrar office at the hospital to complete  an Application for Health Care Benefits. -- Returning Patients (and new patients who have received a letter of approval): Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Eligibility Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Hospital: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservists/National Guard)

agency_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER
agency_desc: A government healthcare agency that provides complete medical, surgical, and neurological care for eligible veterans. Also provides nursing home care for eligible veterans.
site_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER - AUBURN GRESHAM CLINIC
service_description: Provides outpatient primary medical and mental health care for veterans.
site_details: Call for intake information and to schedule an appointment. Eligibility must be determined before service is provided.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged or currently serving US veterans (including reservists/National Guard)

agency_name: JESSE BROWN VETERANS AFFAIRS MEDICAL CENTER

agency_name: VOLUNTEER ADVOCATES FOR SENIORS AND INCAPACITATED ADULTS
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that recruits and trains volunteers to serve as temporary guardians for seniors and incapacitated adults.
site_name: VOLUNTEER ADVOCATES FOR SENIORS AND INCAPACITATED ADULT
service_name: VOLUNTEER ADVOCATES FOR SENIORS AND INCAPACITATED ADULTS
service_description: Provides temporary and permanent guardianship services to at-risk adults throughout Lake County, age 18 or older. VASIA also recruits and trains community volunteers to be volunteer agents for the program in making medical decisions for the appointed guardianships that have been granted by the Probate Court.
site_details: Clients must be referred to the program by a social worker or adult protective services. -- Volunteers must complete the initial application process, the orientation, the health screening programs provided by Franciscan Health Hammond and 40 hours of training time. -- For Vendors wanting to submit a VASIA Referral: Visit the website to access referral form, client face sheet and physicians report. Referral forms can be faxed once completed.
site_eligibility: Clients: Living in Lake County -- Age 18 or older -- No criminal history; Volunteers:: Age 21 or older -- No criminal history

agency_desc: A non-profit that provides personalized learning opportunities for persons with visual impairments to live independently.
service_description: Provides a free multimedia distance education program for adults experiencing vision loss to maintain an independent lifestyle. This programming offers practical ways to address daily living skills through audio lectures, short instructional videos, courses, as well as live and archived webinars.
site_details: Call for free materials and to request an application for tuition free Hadley courses.
site_eligibility: Persons with visual impairments or family members, caregivers, and service providers of those with visual impairments.
